main event: A strange object was observed in the sky over the Atlantic Ocean, which exhibited unusual behavior before exploding.
interesting points: The object was observed visually for 15 minutes, traveling at high speed and then slowing to a stop at low level before blowing up and disintegrating, with no smoke trail or sound detected.
The object appeared to be a rocket cone reentering the atmosphere on a parabolic curve, emitting a long tail of bright red-orange flames before exploding like a skyrocket.
The object was described as larger than a basketball and emitting a high-temperature blue-white light that was extremely bright for about 10 seconds.
The object was observed by an airline pilot and crew, and the sighting was reported to various military and air traffic control authorities.
No photographs of the object were taken, and the investigator concluded it was a routine case with a probable conventional source, with no definite evidence indicating a UFO.
sighted object: A strange object, possibly a rocket cone, that exhibited unusual behavior before exploding
